title: Digital-Based Formative Feedback Design: Utilizing Interactive Feedback Loops

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Mobile learning environment in a smartphone-centric limited-technology setting. Students apply learning content through project-based assessments and experience a dialogic feedback loop exchanging weekly feedback

learning_goals: Learners can engage in peer/instructor feedback dialogues at least twice weekly via a digital platform.
Learners can revise and improve project deliverables two or more times by incorporating feedback.
Learners can reflect on and document their learning progress on a weekly basis using tools such as the GoingOK app.
Learners can enhance the qualitative completeness of social studies projects (e.g., local issue solutions) by over 30% through digital feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
